review: Don't buy this if you want Miracast capabilities. Despite saying it is Miracast™ Certified, it is not listed as certified on their (Miracast) site and it does not work with many Miracast certified devices. It will not work with Windows 8.1 nor does it work well with many of the Android devices I have tested. It works well with the other "Fire" devices and with a few Android tablets/phone. If it was truly certified it would work with all the other certified devices.I purchased it to use for Plex, which it does not do a great job with either. First off, they have a known problem with getting anything more than stereo for sound, so if you have a nice home theater setup, you will be disappointed. Again I have heard from both Plex and Amazon that they are working on that. There is also a lot of stuttering on playback of higher quality videos.I also have a FireTV and it also suffers from the Plex issue and I am sure the Miracast as well. So it is not just about power, it is something with the coding.The app selecting is limited, very limited, but being pretty new I can deal with it. I was shocked to see that it does not have a browser, especially their own Silk browser. This causes issues if you take this with you to a hotel and it needs to open a web page to enter credentials or even pay. I think they are missing a major opportunity here.This device is fine for a secondary tv or at hotels that don't require a browser to access the network.
